name: Introduction to Urban Studies　01
professor: ディマ　クリスティアン
category: Culture, Mind and Body and Community
level: 中級レベル（発展・応用）
subtitle: Public & Private in the City: Theories, Practices and Spaces
textbook:
Madanipour, Ali 2000. Public Space in the City. In: Knox, P. & Ozolins, P. (eds.) Design Professionals and the Built Environment. New York: John Wiley & Sons.

Selected sections of the book will be uploaded via Course Navi

evaluation_method.name: レポート
evaluation_method.detail:
Short Project Proposal, brief sketch of public space experiment/ observation/ study, its significance, posing first research questions, describe the research set-up, location. (10%)
Short Mid-term Research Report (20%)
Final Research Report (30%)

evaluation_method.name: 平常点評価
evaluation_method.detail: Active participation and regular attendance

evaluation_method.name: その他
evaluation_method.detail: Mid-term Student Group Presentation (30%)

name: Social Design & Design Thinking for Urban Change　51
professor: ディマ　クリスティアン
level: 上級レベル
subtitle: Transition Design & Community Innovations
textbook: There is no single core textbook. All related reading materials will be made available through the Course-Navi system.

evaluation_method.name: レポート
evaluation_method.detail:
Mapping and analysis of one selected ‘wicked problem’ and brief sketch of 2 interventions that tackle it at various scales and leverage points. (15％)
Mid-term report: Elaboration of the initially outlined ‘wicked problem’ (20％）
Final report: Students develop their analysis further, based on the mid-term review and mid-term report. (35％)

evaluation_method.name: 平常点評価
evaluation_method.detail: Attendance and active participation

evaluation_method.name: その他
evaluation_method.detail: Mid-term student group presentation as intermediate project review for final report (20％)

name: Korean I 01
professor: 布袋　敏博／近藤　友梨
level: 初級レベル（入門・導入）
textbook:
Let’s study Korean (work edited by Toshihiro HOTEI, Wonsop SHIM, Mikang LEE; Aruku)
『学ぼう 韓国・朝鮮語』（布袋敏博・沈元燮・李美江共著、アルク刊）

evaluation_method.name: その他
evaluation_method.detail:
Grading is based on the comprehensive evaluation which includes attendance, frequency of tardy, completion of the assignments, general attitude in the class, mid-term, and final examination. When and if absence becomes conspicuous, names will be deleted from the roster. Absence caused by illness or job hunting would be exempted the attendance policy.

The course is team taught by two faculty members. Students are obliged to attend classes taught by both faculty members. When and if students only attend one class session taught by a faculty member and neglect to attend the other class, students would not receive any credit. Even if a student receives a passing grade from the final examination, neglecting to attend both classes taught by both faculty members would be nullified.

Students at SILS tend to be late and do not seem to carefully prepare for the class. Each student shall be responsible for his/her general study habit such as reviewing and following the curriculum and organize study materials. Moreover, each student should not forget to bring required textbooks.

evaluation_method.name: その他
evaluation_method.detail:
Grading is based on the comprehensive evaluation which includes attendance, frequency of tardy, completion of the assignments, general attitude in the class, mid-term, and final examination. When and if absence becomes conspicuous, names will be deleted from the roster. Absence caused by illness or job hunting would be exempted the attendance policy.

The course is team taught by two faculty members. Students are obliged to attend classes taught by both faculty members. When and if students only attend one class session taught by a faculty member and neglect to attend the other class, students would not receive any credit. Even if a student receives a passing grade from the final examination, neglecting to attend both classes taught by both faculty members would be nullified.

Students at SILS tend to be late and do not seem to carefully prepare for the class. Each student shall be responsible for his/her general study habit such as reviewing and following the curriculum and organize study materials. Moreover, each student should not forget to bring required textbooks.
